import React from 'react'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import Header from '../components/Header'; import Footer from '../components/Footer'; const Science = () => { return (
{/* Hero Section */}

The Poetry of Reality.

An exploration of the cosmos, from the quantum realm to the vastness of space, through the lens of evidence and wonder.

{/* Founder's Introduction to Science */}

Our Approach to Inquiry

"I founded this club because I believe science is one of the most profound spiritual paths we can walk. It is a discipline of humility, of being willing to let go of what we think we know in the face of new evidence. It is a practice of pure wonder. Here, we don't treat science as a set of cold facts, but as an ongoing story of discoveryâ€”a love letter from the universe to itself, and we are the privileged ones who get to read it."

- [Your Name], Founder

{/* Core Areas of Exploration Section */}

Our Fields of Inquiry

{/* Field 1: Cosmology */}

Cosmology

From the Big Bang to the mysteries of dark matter and dark energy, we explore the origin, evolution, and fate of our universe.

{/* Field 2: Neuroscience */}

Neuroscience

We investigate the 3-pound universe inside our skulls, seeking to understand how the brain gives rise to thought, emotion, and consciousness itself.

{/* Field 3: Quantum Physics */}

Quantum Physics

Diving into the strange and wonderful world of the very small, where particles can be in two places at once and reality is not what it seems.

{/* Field 4: Biology */}

Biology & Evolution

Unraveling the elegant story of life on Earth, from the first single-celled organism to the incredible complexity of the human form.

{/* Quote Section */}
"The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science."
- Albert Einstein
{/* Join Us CTA */}

Join the Great Inquiry

Our guest lectures and discussion circles are where we challenge our assumptions and celebrate discovery. Join us to ask big questions in good company.

Find a Discussion
); }; export default Science;
